snippet: Islanders can spend more time overseas before forfeiting their residency, a concession that reflects the government’s desire for closer ties with Cubans abroad.
abstract: Memo from Cuba; new Cuban migration rules will allow islanders to spend more time overseas before they forfeit their residency, concession that reflects government’s desire for closer ties with Cubans living abroad; under new rules, most Cubans will need only passport to travel.
lead_paragraph: Islanders can spend more time overseas before forfeiting their residency, a concession that reflects the government’s desire for closer ties with Cubans abroad.

headline.seo: New Rules Allow Cubans to Keep Residency Amid Travel
headline.main: After Decades, Cuba Eases Travel Rules to Maintain Ties
headline.print_headline: After Decades, Easing Travel Rules to Maintain Ties
